materials.raw_text:
Iron(III) oxide (Fe2O3) - 48.0 g 
 Phosphate (P2O5) - 16.0 g 
 Vanadium(IV) oxide (VO2) - 4.0 g 
 Distilled water - 32.0 g 
 Binder (Polyvinyl alcohol) - 10.0 g

sourcing.instructions:
Iron(III) oxide can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online suppliers. 
 Phosphate can be obtained from agricultural supply stores or chemical distributors. 
 Vanadium(IV) oxide is available through specialized chemical suppliers. 
 Distilled water is available at grocery stores or pharmacies. 
 Polyvinyl alcohol can be sourced from craft stores or chemical suppliers.

1. Measure out 48.0 g of Iron(III) oxide and place it in a clean mixing bowl.
2. Add 16.0 g of Phosphate to the bowl.
3. Measure out 4.0 g of Vanadium(IV) oxide and add it to the mixture.
4. In a separate container, dissolve 10.0 g of Polyvinyl alcohol in 32.0 g of distilled water, stirring until fully dissolved.
5. Gradually add the dissolved Polyvinyl alcohol solution to the powdered mixture, stirring continuously to form a homogeneous paste.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 48.0 g of Iron(III) oxide and place it in a clean mixing bowl. 
 2. Add 16.0 g of Phosphate to the bowl. 
 3. Measure out 4.0 g of Vanadium(IV) oxide and add it to the mixture. 
 4. In a separate container, dissolve 10.0 g of Polyvinyl alcohol in 32.0 g of distilled water, stirring until fully dissolved. 
 5. Gradually add the dissolved Polyvinyl alcohol solution to the powdered mixture, stirring continuously to form a homogeneous paste.
